bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registered employer or former registered employer must retain all records relating to the recruitment services received from a foreign worker recruiter and to the hiring of a foreign national, including the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all contracts entered into with the foreign worker recruiter;
all fees and expenses the registered employer or former registered employer was requested to pay by the foreign worker recruiter or paid to the foreign worker recruiter;
the name, address and work location of the foreign national;

if applicable, the approval given by the Government of Canada for the registered employer or former registered employer to recruit foreign workers that is associated with the position the foreign national was hired into;
all payroll records associated with the foreign national.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Records referred to in subsections (1) and (2) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be retained for a period of at least 4 years after the date on which they were created,
be made available for inspection by the director on the request of the director, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a licensee or registered employer, be kept at the principal place of business in British Columbia of the licensee or employer, and
a former licensee or former registered employer, be kept in British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person owes an amount under a determination or an order of the tribunal to another person, the person owing the amount must pay interest at the prescribed rate on the amount owed from the date a complaint about the amount owed is delivered to an office of the Employment Standards Branch to the date of payment.
